intro: Cruckshanksia cistiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cistiflora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. Native to the mountainous regions of South Africa, this plant thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. It is typically found in rocky or sandy habitats, often growing in open woodlands or on slopes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
